column4: Greetings. I need to get the package libgnome-2.0 for Ubuntu Hardy.
I'm trying to build the latest version of GnoTime and I am getting this error when I run .configure
checking for LIBGNOME... configure: error: Package requirements (libgnome-2.0 >= 2.0.0) were not met
gnotime is in the repositories - why are you compiling?
because I wanted the latest version. the version in the repository is a few versions old
Run this, then: sudo apt-get build-dep gnutime
OK, did that, now I'm getting
checking for XSS_EXTENSION... configure: error: Package requirements (xscrnsaver) were not met: No package 'xscrnsaver' found
I can only assume it's asking for xscreensaver
update. I solved it. thanks. needed libxss-dev for that
if you want the package to be managed under apt, have a look at checkinstall
thanks again, it worked like a charm. :) bye
